intro: Urostigma tweedieanum, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink or purple, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
